result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trenton Elliot Tomberlin

records.addlTxt: Notice of Availability of Certified Medical Records

The defendant shall have absolutely no contact with the victim, or their residence, by any means, or through a third party.  No use or possession of any firearms, knives, or dangerous weapons.  Must reside at Ruth House.  Must be engaged in a domestic violence program while at the Ruth House.  Defendant may be employed, but must reside at the Ruth House.  If he stops residing at the Ruth House for any reason, he must return to jail and Court will review bond at that time.  Defendant may not leave the State of Wisconsin without court approval.

9:10 AM Defendant Trenton Elliot Tomberlin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Trenton Elliot Tomberlin.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: requesting trial date, also intends to argue for bond modification.  State believes it will be a 2 day trial.  Atty Erdman notes she intends to file a prior acts motion, wants to be preserved on that, will be filing in advance.  Atty Erdman argues for bond modification.  Def makes additional statement in support of bond modification, indicates he could post $1,000 cash.  Def's family makes statement.  State responds, wants additional conditions if the defendant is to be released.  Victim appears, makes statement.  State recites the offer that's been extended- plea to Ct 1, DRI others, PSI, free to argue.  Discussion of def's appearance history.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial on November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

12:04 PM Defendant Trenton Elliot Tomberlin in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman in court for Trenton Elliot Tomberlin.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case on for Status Conference.  Defense attorney updates the Court: requesting bond modification, not resolved at this time.  State has not sent offer, Atty Rennicke to send one.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:11 PM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trenton Elliot Tomberlin in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Trenton Elliot Tomberlin.  Case is on for preliminary hearing.  Discussion of all in person hearing.  Def to be kept in Burnett County jail (not being transferred out), def asks for bond modification; def wants to talk to his attorney in person.  Defendant wishes to proceed with the preliminary hearing, waives all in person hearing KIV.  Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Travis Thiex, who is sworn in and testifies by Court.  Witness has identified the defendant.  No cross by Atty Erdman.  Venue is made.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information- charges to mirror amended complaint, notes an amended complaint will be filed correcting dates.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Atty Erdman filed a bond motion; Court willing to hear.  Atty Erdman argues for bond modification.  State responds, opposes bond modification.  Court denies bond modification.  Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on September 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:39 PM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Trenton Elliot Tomberlin appeared by video, in custody appearing from Bayfield County Jail.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Trenton Elliot Tomberlin.  Atty Erdman requests breakout room.  Off the record 2:40 PM.  Back on the record 2:49 PM, same appearances.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Court acknowledges his bond modification requests.  DA argues to leave cash component as-is or if reduces, leave it at at least $1k cash.  Court notes VR compliance not met to hear a bond motion.  Erdman okayed to appear by Zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

The defendant shall have no contact with the victim or their residence.  No use or possession of any firearms, knives, or dangerous weapons.  If the defendant and victim reside together, the defendant may make 1 trip to the residence with law enforcement to collect his personal belongings.
